alert.note: Alert for White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 12:35PM CDT until August 09 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois and Southwest Indiana, including the following counties, in southern Illinois, White. In Southwest Indiana, Posey. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1233 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported continued flooding over roads east of New Harmony and on Caborn Rd. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Mount Vernon, Carmi, Grayville, Norris City, Poseyville, New Harmony, Crossville, Enfield, Cynthiana, Blairsville, New Haven, Mill Shoals, Griffin, Maunie, Springerton, Burnt Prairie and Phillipstown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
